person.persName: James H. Johns (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Henry L. Johns and Elizabeth Johns. Filed a marriage bond to Mary A. Cram Johns in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on August 25, 1863. Father of Laura Johns. Student in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in Abram G. Wileman's Company of the Police Guard Kentucky Central Railroad (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from November 5, 1861, to November 17, 1861. Served in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from February 8, 1862, to January 3, 1863. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A) as captain from August 31, 1863, to December 30, 1864.
